instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma. no any liquid damage, board is in pristine condition. i don't have any history of the macbook. i opened it first time.i don't have brd and shematics for this model. couldn't find on web. first i did visual inspection and i found blown capacitor and i checked and line was shorted.(don't know name of shorted line) after remove capacitor shor was gone but still 5v 0.02ma. now i am checking voltages ( i am using 820-02020 brd)

now i found same model working board and compared that line which was shorted and removed capacitor.  working board have 5v and my faulty board have low voltage 2.2v. so as i think problem is coming still from there.in diode mode both have same resistance to ground 450.anyone know which line is this?

p.s   now i checked UC710 and   PP3v3S2_EN  also have 0v instead of 1.8v.   also i checked other working board and this board must have 20v on charger even if uc710 is removed.

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
Schematic available for download on badcaps forum.
Boardview may be available on XinZhiZao server.

Consult the schematic and come back with detailed information.

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
thanks for info. i just bought that sw. so damaged capacitor was c8430.  PP5V_MPMU_BSTLQ_XW. and now this line have 2.2v instead of 5v. i think its u8100 problem.can you advice me something else?

1)  PPBUS_AON  12.28v
2)  PP3v8_AON   3.8v
3)   PP3v3_S2      0v
4)  P3V3S2_SW    0v
5)  P3v3S2_EN  0v
6)   PP1V8_S2 0V
7)  P3V3S2_DSCHG_EN_RC  3.45V
8)  PP5v_S2    0v
9) PP1v25_S2  0V
10) PP3V3_S2_USBLS1_ISNS  0V
11) PP3V3_S2SW_SNS        0v
12) PP3V3_S2_LDO       0v
13) PP3V3_S2_WLBT_ISNS   0v

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground on that line with good board, if possible.
Also check all U8100's LDOs in page 38.

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
good board/faulty board format


PPBUS_AON  12.28v      480/480

PP3v8_AON    3.8v      157/322                so in this line bad board have high value not low!

PP3v3_S2        0v     402/401

P3V3S2_SW    0v        402/301

P3v3S2_EN     0v       703/701

PP1V8_S2        0V     336/336

P3V3S2_DSCHG

_EN_RC     3.45V       523/535

PP5v_S2         0v     435/388

PP1v25_S2     0V       243/242

PP3V3_S2
USBLS1_ISNS  0V     445/439

PP3V3_S2SW_SNS   0v   493/499

PP3V3_S2_LDO       0v    445/439

PP3V3_S2_WLBT_ISNS   0v   402/403

do you mean page 38 of the shematic?

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
if anyone know, from where can i get u8100 for this board. can i take it from another model?
343S00554

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
We don't have any certain information about M2 components compatibility yet.
For M1, PMUs are interchangeable for 14" and 16".

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message: but m1 pmu maybe isn't interchangeable to m2 yes ?

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
No idea yet.
If they have the same layout, you can try.

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message: i checked and not same layout. so not same. but  i dont have ipad m2 models layout maybe same. need to check that also. do you have any source fron where can i buy this ic ?

threads.title: A2338 M2 820-02773 5v 0.02ma
threads.message:
For new Macs, get scrap boards.
However, even that is not easy...
